Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  He aimed at the target.

Vocabularies.Definition: take a bold decisive step, esp. after thinking about it for some time（尤指经过一番思考后）采取断然行动
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  He took the plunge by investing all his savings in the stock market.

Vocabularies.Definition: a.  (derog) always ready to quarrel or attack; threatening  爱挑衅的，好斗的；侵略的
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  They were drunk, aggressive and looking for a fight.

Vocabularies.Definition: to the advantage of sb.  对某人有利
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  The protection that farmers have enjoyed amounts to a bias in favor of the countryside.

Vocabularies.Definition: move towards (a place)  向（某处）行进
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  These people are heading for the city hall.
e.g.  When does the next train depart?

Vocabularies.Definition: vt.  provide evidence for the truth of; establish the truth of  证实；确认
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  Please confirm your telephone message by writing to me.

Vocabularies.Definition: vt.      force (sth. unwanted or unpleasant) on  使遭受
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  The sufferings inflicted on the children were terrible to see.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.  (usu. pl.)     condition or fact connected with another event or action  环境；情形；情况 in/under the/no circumstances 在这种情况下／在任何情况下决不
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  Maybe under these circumstances we may say that man can conquer nature.

Vocabularies.Definition: vt. speak in favor of; support 主张；提倡
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g. Our premier advocates higher salaries for teachers.

Vocabularies.Definition: vt. come to believe (sth.) as a result of reasoning; reach a decision; bring to an end 断定，得出结论；决定；结束
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g. The doctor concluded that the patient's disease was cancer.

Vocabularies.Definition: vt. (AmE) make sure; guarantee 确保；保证
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g. Carefulness insures you against errors.
e.g. We can count on Lisa to keep her promise.

Vocabularies.Definition: vt. make a favorable judgment of 推荐
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  Can you recommend a good dictionary?

Vocabularies.Definition: n. the force of one object hitting another 冲击力
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  Under the impact of the waves, rocks along the coast have lost their edges.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. anything fired at in shooting practice 靶；目标
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  The hunter's target was a wild animal.

Vocabularies.Word: draw the line at sth./doing sth.
Vocabularies.Definition: refuse to do or refuse to tolerate sth. 拒绝做某事；决不容忍某事
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  The criminal declared that he would draw the line at hitting an old lady.

Vocabularies.Definition: enter by force 强行进入
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  The burglar broke in and stole my money.
e.g.  He wouldn't put his career on the line to help a friend.
